__e: You know, that thing he wrote back home in New York that was going to be the redemption of us all?
He was able to convey the most extraordinary thoughts and intricacy of thoughts, and debate and reaction purely by physical, and not just facial but physical reaction to things.
But then the man died, and for 2,000 years, lots and lots of people on Earth have believed that someday he's going to come back to save us.
You could say I'm here to save you.
If you don't have a son to redeem you...
Alive, you might just be able to redeem yourself.
Goodness, that's a bit of a mouthful.
Look, John, no offense, I just don't think that it's a great idea, you know you going on a solo mission to save the world.
But the fairy told me to save the world.
You think you could save me?
Perhaps you are an angel sent to save me.
You guys don't hold the keys to my redemption. The only person who can do that...
For if I am your salvation, you are mine.
Remember, redemption is always possible for the man who desires it, my brother.
Salvation isn't just about being saved from hell after you die.
